0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment: 185 megabecquerels (5 millicuries) in a maximum of 10 mL as a single IV bolus within 40 seconds; MAX mass dose 20 mcg IV

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy have not been established in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
PET brain study, To estimate beta-amyloid neuritic plaque density in patients with cognitive impairment

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: hypersensitivity to flutemetamol F 18, polysorbate 80, or any component of the product

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity reactions (eg, flushing, dyspnea) have been reported within minutes of administration, including patients with no prior exposure; monitoring recommended
  • imaging interpretation errors have occurred; increased risk with extensive brain atrophy or motion artifacts
  • radiation exposure; radiopharmaceutical administration contributes to long-term cumulative radiation exposure, which is associated with increased cancer risk

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Flutemetamol F 18 binds to beta-amyloid plaques in the brain. The F 18 isotope of flutemetamol F 18 produces a positron signal that is detected by positron emission tomography (PET) scanning. Flutemetamol F 18 crosses the blood brain barrier and subsequent cerebral perfusion decreases the flutemetamol F 18 in the brain, with differential drug retention in cortical areas that contain beta-amyloid aggregates. Difference in signal intensity between brain regions that may specifically retain flutemetamol F 18 and those that do not are the basis of image interpretation.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • use proper procedures for handling and disposal of radiopharmaceuticals
  • maintain appropriate shielding during handling and administration
  • wear waterproof gloves during the handling procedure
  • do not dilute
  • administer IV bolus within 40 seconds, follow with IV 5 to 15 mL saline flush
  • encourage patients to void before and after imaging procedure and frequently for 24 hours after administration

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• pregnancy test; prior to administration in women of childbearing potential
  • signs and symptoms of hypersensitivity; following drug administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include flushing, hypertension, headache, dizziness, or nausea.
  • Tell patient to void as often as possible for 24 hours after the procedure.
